summary: This service procedure outlines the removal and replacement of the shock tower brace on a Tesla Model Y. It involves disconnecting LV power and the HVIL connector, carefully repositioning the A/C compressor and supermanifold assemblies. Reinstallation requires specific torque values for various bolts and an assistant to support components, with attention to electrical and component handling safety.
safety_flags: Involves High Voltage (HV) components and HVIL disconnection/connection
Specific caution against resting A/C compressor on HV connector
prerequisites: Assistant required for A/C compressor and supermanifold handling

summary: This procedure outlines the removal and replacement of the cowl screen bracket on a Tesla Model Y. It involves detaching the cowl screen panel, positive jumper post, and associated bolts, then releasing two tabs to remove the bracket. Installation proceeds in reverse order, with specific torque values provided for the stud bolt (8 Nm) and bracket bolt (7 Nm).
safety_flags: Personal Protection: make sure wearing proper PPE
Ergonomic Precautions for safe and healthy working practices
prerequisites: Flat Rate Times knowledge (for FRT understanding)

summary: This procedure outlines the removal and replacement of the Left-Hand (LH) Front End Module (FEM) bracket for a Tesla Model Y. It requires extensive preliminary disassembly, including the underhood storage unit, front lightbar, LH front wheel, and front fascia assembly. The process involves disconnecting various electrical harnesses and sensors, followed by precise reinstallation with specific torque specifications for the bracket bolts and reassembly of all previously removed components.
